banner.title: TP WorkLife 10/12
banner.mainContentHeadline: The podcast where science meets business
banner.mainContent: From fixing meetings to finding a mentor, get new insights to help you enjoy your time at work and thrive in your career.

videoData.title: The best gift I ever survived
videoData.socialTitle: The best gift I ever survived

nodes.whatOthersSay: The next time you face something that's unexpected, unwanted, and uncertain, consider that it just may be a gift.
nodes.whoTheyAre: Stacey Kramer has traveled the United States and the world helping to create names and brands for growing companies.
nodes.whyListen:
Co-founder of Brandplay, a brand strategy firm, Stacey Kramer also founded Word for Word, a naming and branding consultancy serving national and global companies -- from big, recognizable names to next year's newsmaking startups.

In 2009, Kramer found herself confronting a terrifying diagnosis: a CAT scan revealed she had a brain tumor -- the size of a golf ball. She told her remarkable, personal story at TED2010.

videoData.description: Stacey Kramer offers a moving, personal, 3-minute parable that shows how an unwanted experience -- frightening, traumatic, costly -- can turn out to be a priceless gift.
videoData.socialDescription: Stacey Kramer offers a moving, personal, 3-minute parable that shows how an unwanted experience -- frightening, traumatic, costly -- can turn out to be a priceless gift.

cues.text: Imagine, if you will -- a gift.
I'd like for you to picture it in your mind.
about the size of a golf ball.
So envision what it looks like all wrapped up.
But before I show you what's inside,
I will tell you, it's going to do incredible things for you.
It will bring all of your family together.
You will feel loved and appreciated like never before
and reconnect with friends and acquaintances
you haven't heard from in years.
It will recalibrate what's most important in your life.
You'll have unsurpassed vitality and energy.
and you'll have a healthier lifestyle.
Flowers will arrive by the truckload.
"You look great. Have you had any work done?"
And you'll have a lifetime supply
Your life will have new meaning.
By now I know you're dying to know
what it is and where you can get one.
Does it have the Apple logo on it?
This gift came to me about five months ago.
It looked more like this when it was all wrapped up --
the gift that keeps on giving.
I wouldn't wish this gift for you.
I'm not sure you'd want it.
But I wouldn't change my experience.
in all the ways I just shared with you.
So the next time you're faced
that it just may be a gift.
